definitions.definition: an official process to find out the cause of something or to find out information about something
definitions.labels: (British English)(North American English)(British English)(North American English)(especially British English)(especially British English)(especially North American English)(especially British English)

examples.text: a **public enquiry** into the environmental effects of the proposed new road
to **hold/conduct/launch an enquiry** into the affair

definitions.definition: a request for information about somebody/something; a question about somebody/something

examples.text: enquiries from prospective students about courses
We received over 300 enquiries about the job.
Greetings and enquiries about family members tend to be in the local dialect.
I'll have to **make** a few **enquiries** *(= try to find out about it)* and get back to you.
All enquiries should be addressed to the customer services department.
Two men have been **helping police with their enquiries** *(= are being questioned about a crime, but have not been charged with it)*.

definitions.definition: the act of asking questions or collecting information about somebody/something

examples.text: The police are following several **lines of enquiry**.

definitions.definition: a place where you can get information

examples.text: Ask at enquiries to see if your bag has been handed in.
